title: Calories in One Fried Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in one fried egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and simple tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in 1 tsp oil or butter; sunny-side up or over-easy, minimal added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fat amount, cooking method, and brand; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One large fried egg provides ~90 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in non-stick pan, no added fat
Add 1 slice of cheese on top

faqs.q: How many calories in one fried egg?
faqs.a: About 90 kcal for one large fried egg with minimal added fat.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.3 g protein per large fried egg.

faqs.q: Does frying add more calories than boiling?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added oil or butter; boiled is ~78 kcal vs. 90 kcal fried.

faqs.q: Are fried eggs high in fat?
faqs.a: About 7 g total fat per egg, mostly from the yolk and cooking fat.

faqs.q: How does egg size affect fried egg calories?
faqs.a: Medium eggs ~70 kcal, extra-large ~110 kcal; scale based on size.
